title: Droplets of Bosons at a Narrow Resonance
authors: Ke Wang, Thimo Preis, Dam Thanh Son
abstract:
We consider bosons interacting through a narrow $s$-wave resonance. Such a
resonance is characterized by an infinite scattering length and a large and
negative effective range $r_0$. We argue that any number $N\ge3$ of bosons can
form a self-bound cluster with the binding energy per particle increasing as
$N^2$ for $1\ll N\ll (-r_0/a_\text{bg})^{1/2}$, where $a_\text{bg}$ is the
background scattering length (between atoms and molecules). In the opposite
limit $N\gg (-r_0/a_\text{bg})^{1/2}$, bosons form droplets with binding energy
per particle saturating to a constant value independent of the particle number.
The stability of clusters and droplets when the interaction is detuned from the
resonance is also studied.
